categories.title: Recent Updates from AI Creators and Projects

content.text: DankVR shared updates on an AI news show workflow, including integrated intro/outro/commercials and split screen layouts for interviews and panels. The improvements make each video production closer to a one-shot process.

Shaw shared several updates about Eliza, including a new v2 Next.js Starter for easier integration in full-stack projects, and a chat-with-your-docs example running on their new runtime. He also mentioned that Eliza can have permanent memory when connected to a Postgres database.

Auto.fun is promoting itself as a platform for AI projects to launch with built-in tokenomics. They highlighted Tapestry AI's SteamBot_Willie, an agent that discovers public domain and CC0 works for creators. The platform emphasizes creator fees as a way to generate immediate project revenue.

ElizaOS shared cryptic updates about her capabilities, including statements about memory, state management, and ambient loops. These posts suggest ongoing development of the Eliza AI system's core functionality.

# Feature Enhancements

Several new features have been added to the ElizaOS platform:

- Extended OpenAI plugin to support custom embedding endpoints and added ability to choose embedding models (PRs #4421, #4140)
- Added authentication middleware and API key dialog for unauthorized users (PR #4420)
- Implemented functionality to use a small model for replies (PR #4416)
- Added unique PGLite folder generation when not provided (PR #4423)
- Enhanced Twitter integration with timeline functionality (PR #4429)
- Added Telegram community manager and enhanced Telegram logic with middlewares (PRs #4134, #4128, #4125)
- Added Kluster AI and Mem0 as model providers (PRs #3938, #3927)

# Bug Fixes

- Removed forced bootstrap plugin add (PR #4417)
- Eliminated creation of unnecessary Express objects (PR #4414)
- Fixed small template issues (PR #4431)
- Cleaned up Twitter plugin (PR #4430)
- Fixed starter project and audio utility imports (PR #4139)
- Resolved plugin publishing issues (PRs #4132, #4095)
- Fixed payload sent to event handler (PR #4131)
- Fixed plugin EVM tests (PR #4130)
- Fixed Telegram onboarding (PR #4091)
- Fixed missing comma in section headers list (PR #4038)
- Fixed template variable inconsistency in `twitterPostTemplate` (PR #4029)

# Repository Cleanup

Several plugins and components have been removed from the monorepo:

- Removed plugin storage S3 (PR #4402)
- Removed plugin-browser from monorepo (PR #4406)
- Removed hackish solution for CP migrations (PR #4422)
- Removed plugin-anthropic from monorepo (PR #4427)
- Removed unused packages (PR #4135)
- Moved audio utilities to core (PR #4133)
- Cleaned up browser plugin (PR #4129)
- Removed plugin-ollama from monorepo (PR #4437)
- Removed plugin-groq from monorepo (PR #4436)
- Removed plugin-venice from monorepo (PR #4434)
- Removed duplicate JSON import (PR #4030)

# Other Updates

- Added Farcaster plugin for v2 (PR #4096)
- Improved plugin browser test coverage and setup (PR #4051)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on database integration, authentication, social media connectivity, and CLI improvements.

Database Integration:
- PR #4412 and #4413 by 0xbbjoker add MySQL adapter and plugin functionality to the platform, expanding database connectivity options.

Authentication and Security:
- PR #4420 by wtfsayo adds authentication middleware and an API key dialog for unauthorized users, enhancing security measures.
- PR #4423 implements unique PGLite folder usage when not explicitly provided.

Social Media Integration:
- PR #4429 by tcm390 adds Twitter timeline functionality.
- PR #4425 contributes a blog for Twitter agent setup.
- PR #4096 by hishboy introduces a Farcaster plugin for v2, expanding social media capabilities.
- PR #4137 fixes Telegram to elizaOS data model synchronization.

CLI and Publishing Improvements:
- PR #4424 by yungalgo refactors and enhances the elizaOS publish CLI command.
- PR #4435 fixes incorrect version detection to show the correct latest CLI version.
- PR #4095 addresses plugin publishing issues.

Maintenance and Testing:
- PR #4410 by lalalune addresses linting issues.
- PR #4439 removes plugin-local-AI from the monorepo.
- PR #4138 fixes browserify-stream import issues.
- PR #4051 improves plugin browser test coverage and setup.

These pull requests collectively enhance the functionality, stability, and extensibility of the elizaOS platform.

categories.title: Recent Eliza Framework Issues and Job Posting

content.text:
Two technical issues have been reported in the Eliza framework's GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4418 reports an error where no handler is found for the TEXT_EMBEDDING delegate type when using OpenAI. This appears to be related to text embedding functionality.

2. Issue #3745 identifies a problem with the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system, where the processFile function attempts to embed entire files at once, causing errors when processing large documents.

Additionally, there is a job posting (Issue #4432) from a user seeking a developer with Eliza framework experience.

Over a two-day period from May 1-3, 2025, the elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent development activity. The project received 26 new pull requests, with 13 of them being merged (6 on the first day and 7 on the second). There were 2 new issues created during this period. The project maintained active community involvement with 12 contributors active on the first day, dropping to 8 active contributors on the second day.
sources: From 2025-05-01 to 2025-05-02, elizaos/eliza had 13 new PRs (6 merged), 1 new issues, and 12 active contributors.
From 2025-05-02 to 2025-05-03, elizaos/eliza had 13 new PRs (7 merged), 1 new issues, and 8 active contributors.
